contents.content: UNIT 01 求职准备 Job Hunting Preparation
Lesson 6 到职介机构询问 Consulting the Intermediary
杰克和玛丽在谈论去职介机构询问工作。

contents.title: 杰克：玛丽，今天有个中介机构的人给我打电话了。
contents.answer: Jack: Mary, today a man from an intermediary gave me a call.

contents.title: 玛丽：他说什么了？
contents.answer: Mary: What did he say?

contents.title: 杰克：他说在网上看到了我的求职信息，可以给我提供合适的工作。
contents.answer: Jack: He said he saw my job-seeking information on the Internet, and could offer me an appropriate job.

contents.title: 玛丽：是什么样的中介机构啊？
contents.answer: Mary: What kind of intermediary is it?

contents.content: 职场达人小技巧    了解职介机构    职介机构，也就是大家所说的职业介绍机构，是专门为求职者和用人单位提供就业指导与服务的一种组织机构。求职者和用人单位可以将求职信息和招聘信息在职介机构进行登记，职介机构会在中间起到桥梁的作用，作为双方的沟通交流平台。

contents.title: 杰克：是一家代理招聘的机构，专门为公司企业招聘人才的。
contents.answer: Jack: It's a recruiting agency which specializes in introducing talented people to companies and businesses.

contents.title: 玛丽：他给你推荐的是什么工作？
contents.answer: Mary: What job did he recommend to you?

contents.title: 杰克：是一份电话营销的工作。
contents.answer: Jack: It's on telemarketing.

contents.title: 玛丽：要收费吗？
contents.answer: Mary: Does he ask you to pay some fees?

contents.title: 杰克：不收费，他说费用由代理招聘的公司来出。
contents.answer: Jack: No, he said the employers will pay for it.

contents.title: 玛丽：那你感觉怎么样？
contents.answer: Mary: Then what do you think about it?

contents.content: 职业介绍机构可分为非盈利性机构和盈利性机构。非盈利性机构通常是公共性质的机构，由政府劳动部门组织组建，为广大求职者和用人单位提供公益性的服务，并且使用全国统一的标识。

contents.title: 杰克：我觉得还可以，我想去看看。
contents.answer: Jack: I feel it is OK and I want to give it a try.

contents.title: 玛丽：好吧，不过你要问清楚，不要轻易承诺。
contents.answer: Mary: Sure, but you must verify that first and don't easily make a promise.

contents.title: 杰克：当然了，我会的。
contents.answer: Jack: Of course, I will.

contents.title: 玛丽：祝你好运！
contents.answer: Mary: Good luck!

contents.content: 而盈利性机构一般是由个人或其他组织成立的，以盈利为目的的职业介绍服务机构。求职者和用人单位如果想在这里获取职位信息或人才信息，就需要支付一定的费用。

contents.title: 现在许多职介机构都为求职者提供职位信息。
contents.answer: Now many intermediaries will provide job information for job-hunters.

contents.title: 职介机构服务于用人单位和求职者。
contents.answer: Intermediaries serve both employers and job-hunters.

contents.title: 参加招聘会是一种有效的求职途径。
contents.answer: Some job-hunters choose to go to intermediaries to inquire about job vacancies.

contents.title: 求职者可以拨打职介中心的电话进行咨询。
contents.answer: Job-hunters can carry on a consultation by calling the intermediary.

contents.title: 有些职介中心是收费的。
contents.answer: Some intermediaries will charge you a fee.

contents.title: 职介中心提供的招聘信息还是值得考虑的。
contents.answer: The job information provided by the intermediary is worth considering.

contents.title: 我经常去职介中心寻找工作。
contents.answer: I often go to the intermediary to look for jobs.

contents.title: 对于职介中心提供的职位信息要仔细查证。
contents.answer: You should carefully check the job information offered by an intermediary.

contents.title: 不要轻易相信职介机构。
contents.answer: Don't easily trust an intermediary.

contents.title: 求职者可以在职介中心登记自己的信息。
contents.answer: Job-hunters could register their information with the intermediaries.
